subject: Re: Object Graph Diff
msgSnippet: ... I might just change the attribute in a1 that I expect to the value I expect in a2 , and then compare them for equality. IE: a1 = someProcess(parm1); a2
messageBody:
--- "haefeleuser" <haefeleuser@...> wrote:
> I need to compare two object graphs for my JUnit test.
> Example: A -> B -> C
> Each class has a couple of attributes.
> A contains B which contains C.
> I have two instances of A: a1 and a2.
> [...]
> Now I expect that only a certain attribute is different
> between a1 and a2. I don't want to retest all the
> attributes. So I want to test just the difference
> between a1 and a2 object graph.

I might just change the attribute in 'a1' that I expect to the value
I expect in 'a2', and then compare them for equality.

IE:
a1 = someProcess(parm1);
a2 = someProcess(parm2);
a1.setAttr(2.5); // the one difference we expect
assertEquals(a1, a2);

If the object's '.equals' method isn't sufficient, you may have to
write a recursive reflection based comparison operator. (I'll leave
that as an exercise to the student. ;-)
